result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin W. Wallace

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 8:52 AM Defendant Kevin W. Wallace in court.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Kevin W. Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court accepts waiver; finds probable cause and binds over to Br 1; proceeds to arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin W. Wallace
Current: 1537 Delaware Blvd, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 14 Reids Drive, Waupun, WI 53963

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with co-actor Carolyn M. Moore, her residence and her family. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:54 PM Defendant Kevin W. Wallace appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley (eligible) appeared by video for Kevin W. Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with co-actor Carolyn Moore, her residence and her family. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
